main event: A T-33A pilot observed a fast-moving bright colored light heading south near Grand Junction, Colorado, which was tracked on radar and disappeared suddenly.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on September 20, 1960, and lasted for approximately 10-15 minutes., The light was estimated to be traveling at speeds of 400 to 500 mph., The radar tracked the light 90 miles west of Grand Junction., The pilot estimated the object to be 40-50 miles away., The case was categorized as probably a satellite re-entering.
sighted object: a fast moving bright colored light
